text: Bünyamin Sezer (born July 4, 1988) is a Turkish weightlifter competing in the -62 kg division. He won the silver medal in Snatch category at the 2010 European Weightlifting Championships held in Minsk, Belarus. Sezer recently won gold at the 2011 European Weightlifting Championships and 2012 European Weightlifting Championships.European Weightlifting Championships: Turkish Gold ==Achievements== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan=3|Rank !! rowspan=2 width=250|Competition!! rowspan=2 width=150|Host !! rowspan=2 width=180|Result |- ! ! ! |- ||Image:Silver medal icon.svg||5 ||4 ||2010 European Championships || Minsk || 136+153=289 |- ||Image:Gold medal icon.svg||Image:Bronze medal icon.svg||Image:Gold medal icon.svg ||2011 European Championships || Kazan || 140+158=298 |- ||Image:Bronze medal icon.svg ||15 ||9 ||2011 World Championships || Paris || 141+153=294 |- ||Image:Gold medal icon.svg||Image:Silver medal icon.svg||Image:Gold medal icon.svg ||2012 European Championships || Antalya || 142+159=301 |- ||Image:Gold medal icon.svg||Image:Silver medal icon.svg|| ||2013 Mediterranean Games || Mersin || 135+151 |} ==References== ==External links== *International Weightlifting Federation Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:Turkish male weightlifters Category:Olympic weightlifters of Turkey Category:Weightlifters at the 2012 Summer Olympics Category:European champions in weightlifting Category:European champions for Turkey Category:Mediterranean Games gold medalists for Turkey Category:Mediterranean Games silver medalists for Turkey Category:Competitors at the 2013 Mediterranean Games Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in weightlifting Category:European Weightlifting Championships medalists
